<@539495253418180618> I have a quick question about withdrawals in newPayload. In engine spec we have:
"- `withdrawals`: `Array of WithdrawalV1` - Array of withdrawals, each object is an `OBJECT` containing the fields of a `WithdrawalV1` structure." https://github.com/ralexstokes/execution-apis/blob/add-withdrawal-operations/src/engine/specification.md#executionpayloadv2

However, in EIP-4895 we have:
"The execution payload gains a new field for the withdrawals which is an RLP list of Withdrawal data."
https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4895#new-field-in-the-execution-payload-withdrawals

Should EL expect objects or rlp enoded array (like transactions)? I assume objects, but we want to be 100% sure üôÇ

the format in the engine api is the ‚Äújson rpc‚Äù format we use in that context

when making an execution block as regards consensus, the withdrawals are RLP encoded just like transactions (and the rest of the block)
